sloancone

SDSS conesearching tools via the CL or Python API. Return conesearch results, or simply check whether or not a location in the sky has been covered by SDSS.

Quickstart ∞

Initialising sloancone ∞

Before you begin using sloancone you need to use the init command to generate a user settings file. Running the following:

sloancone init

creates a yaml settings file in your home foler under ~/.config/sloancone/sloancone.yaml. This is where most of the sloancone setting can be adjusted to liking.

Command-Line Usage ∞

    Documentation for sloancone can be found here: http://sloancone.readthedocs.org

    Usage:
        sloancone search [-n] [(-f <outputFormat>)] [(-t <galaxyType>)] <ra> <dec> <arcsecRadius>
        sloancone covered <ra> <dec>

        COMMANDS
        ========
        search                do a conesearch and report the resulting matches
        covered               test whether or not a location in the sky was covered by SDSS

        -h, --help            show this help message
        -n, --nearest         show closest match only
        -f, --format          which format to output (csv, table). Default table
        -t, --galaxyType      which galaxies to search (None, all, specz or photoz). Default None, i.e. return galaxies and stars
